title: Books in Optima
content: I'm looking for books that use Optima as a text typeface. Earliest publication date wins the thread. Anyone?
author: eliason

comments.content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416064006im_/http:/typophile.com/files/optima1970_4892.jpg)
  
This probably isn't the oldest example, but it's the oldest example in my library: James Carroll, _Wonder and Worship_, copyright 1970 by Newman Press, Paramus, NJ, designed by Emil Antonucci.
[Here is a spread](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416064006/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/typeaffair/9218970085/) I just uploaded. It's from a camera/photography book published in 1988.

Zapf's book _About Alphabets_ is in Optima, published in 1970, original Typophiles edition in 1960. [Here's an edition](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416064006/http:/oakknoll.com/detail.php?d_booknr=116327&d_currency=) for sale. And [here's a scan of a page.](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416064006/http:/pingmag.jp/images/article/kobayashi_zapf_book2.jpg)

I'm guessing [the original German version](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416064006/http:/www.abebooks.com/servlet/BookDetailsPL?bi=10315668942&searchurl=kn%3Duber%2Balphabete%2Bzapf%26x%3D35%26y%3D17) is also in Optima. It seems the design was completed in 1958, so the German edition may be the first full book.
Thanks, I appreciate the pics and citations. All useful info!
